text:
The associationTypeId doesn't look right. Get that right and I'd imagine that this wil resolve itself.

The necessary guidance is here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

and this is always useful for standard objects:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/crm-associations-overview>

I wrote a relevant blog post on this last year:
<https://www.spotdev.co.uk/blog/associating-objects-using-HubSpots-custom-coded-workflows>

Does using the Marketing Events API require me to have a proper app with its own endpoints? Most of my API usage so far has been restricted to workflow custom code actions or one time scripts run locally. Might be a silly question but I haven't really looked at marketing events until today when I was asked to. Still haven't really wrapped my head around what the events are. Are they just aggregated data from external sources or can you actually add events directly to HubSpot?

Hello all, I am using HubSpot workflow to send webhook to call our own API, may I know the HubSpot outgoing IPs? We need them to set up HubSpot outgoing IPs in our Cloudflare IP whitelist, for HubSpot to call our own API. Please kindly help, thanks in advance.
Is there a way to add an association label without deleting an already existing one?
With the rise of AI chatbots, has anyone run into the 20s timeout problem with code snippts or webhooks in ChatBot API? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/code-snippets-in-bots>

For example, OpenAI API will sometimes take more than 20s to respond to a request, which will result in timeout in the webhook/code snippet in chatflow. Not an ideal situation. The only resource I can find is this <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Code-snippet-task-timing-out-after-20s/td-p/810143|post>, which does not give a solution to the timeout issue.  Does anyone have a workaround or a way to extend the timeout of webhooks or code snippets in a ChatFlow?
